resources.string: Connection failed. Please check your internet connection and try again.
Unable to connect. Please try again later.
With everyone\'s contribution, Immuni will help contain the virus and get us back to normal as soon as possible.
If you\'ve been in contact with a user who has subsequently tested positive for the virus, Immuni notifies you and gives you instructions to protect your health and the health of your loved ones.
Users who discover that they have been exposed to the virus can self-isolate, slowing down the spread of the virus and helping us return to normal life faster.
The app works without tracking your movements and without knowing your identity or the identity of the people you come into contact with.

string.name: privacy_item_identity
string.b: Immuni does not collect your first name, surname, date of birth, address, telephone number, or email address.

resources.string: Immuni cannot determine your identity or the identity of the people you come into contact with.
Immuni does not collect any geolocation data, including GPS data. Your movements are not tracked in any way.

string.name: privacy_item_secure
string.b: The data saved on your smartphone and the connections to the server are encrypted.

resources.string:
To help the National Health Service take care of you, Immuni tells the Ministry of Health server the following:
- The province where you live
- If the app is working properly
- If you have been warned of a high-risk contact
Your data is saved on servers in Italy, managed by public bodies, and controlled by the Ministry of Health.

string.name: privacy_item_data_deletion
string.b: All data is deleted when it is no longer needed.

resources.string: I declare that I am at least 14 years old
By continuing, I declare that I have read and accepted the <l>terms of use</l>
Which region do you live in?
Select the region where you live to help the National Health Service provide the best possible assistance.
Which province do you live in?
Select the province where you live to help the National Health Service provide the best possible assistance.

Immuni uses Bluetooth Low Energy to log contact with other users so that it can inform you if you have been exposed to the virus. You can temporarily disable the service from the home screen. This service is not available if you\'re running Immuni in a secondary profile or in a work profile.
Select \'Enable\' in the pop-up that appears below
Immuni uses Bluetooth Low Energy to log your contact with other users and to enable COVID-19 exposure notifications.
Notifications allow Immuni to alert you quickly should the need arise.
Select \'Allow\' in the pop-up that appears below

Immuni is strictly for personal use. If you haven\'t done so already, set up a lock code on your smartphone to prevent others from accessing the app\'s features and any messages the app might send you.

Immuni will only ever communicate with you via the app and the corresponding notifications. Be wary of any text, phone call, email, or other kind of alert that appears to be from Immuni, especially if it asks you for personal information.
Even when the app is closed, Immuni continues to operate.
Take action now to allow Immuni to work properly.
What you can do to protect yourself
Risky exposure detected: contact with a COVID-19-positive person
Find out what to do now ›
Follow the instructions provided by your general practitioner or local health authority
<h>Immuni assigns a random code to each phone</h>
The code is generated randomly and does not contain information about your device, let alone about you. It also changes several times an hour to ensure your privacy is protected.
<h>Phones that come into contact exchange their random codes</h>

When you come into contact with another Immuni user, the devices exchange their codes via Bluetooth Low Energy. That\'s how the app can keep track of the contact without knowing your identities or where you came into contact.
<h>Users who test positive can choose if they want to share their random codes</h>

Users who have tested positive for the virus can upload to a server the random codes that their devices have sent out over the previous days, making them available to other users. This process is carried out with the assistance of the healthcare operator who informs you that your swab has tested positive.
<h>Each phone checks if it has previously encountered any of the shared codes</h>
Immuni periodically checks the codes on the server and compares them with those saved on your device. This allows it to determine if you have been exposed to a potential infection risk.
<h>The user is notified if there is a positive match</h>
If you\'ve been in contact with a positive user, Immuni notifies you and tells you what to do. It does all this without ever knowing where you\'ve been and who you\'ve met. Your privacy is safe.

If you are in contact with your general practitioner or your local health authority\'s healthcare service, follow all the instructions provided to you.
In any case, try to follow these general guidelines at all times:
Immuni has detected that you came into close contact with a COVID-19-positive user on %@.

string.name: suggestions_positive_subtitle
string.b: Follow all the instructions that you have received from your general practitioner or from your local health authority\'s healthcare service.

string.name: suggestions_instruction_ministerial_decree
string.b: Comply with the current regulations in your area.

resources.string: Wash your hands frequently with soap and water or with alcohol hand sanitiser.

string.name: suggestions_instruction_use_napkins
string.b: Cough and sneeze directly into a tissue or into the crook of your elbow.

resources.string: Respect physical distancing measures and avoid gatherings.
Wear a mask in indoor public places. This includes public transport and all situations where it is not possible to ensure that a safe distance is maintained at all times.
To protect your health and the health of your loved ones, please follow these guidelines:

string.name: suggestions_instruction_contact_doctor_title
string.b: Contact your general practitioner (or primary care paediatrician)

resources.string: Explain to your general practitioner that you have received a COVID-19 close contact notification from Immuni. Follow your general practitioner\'s instructions. Your general practitioner will contact your local health authority\'s healthcare service. Therefore, you should ensure that you remain contactable by your local health authority for health monitoring activities.
If you\'re in contact with your general practitioner or local health authority, you can hide this alert.
I have contacted my general practitioner
As a precaution, while you wait for instructions from your general practitioner or local health authority:
Stay at home for 14 days after the date of contact.

string.name: suggestions_instruction_check_symptoms_title
string.b: Measure your body temperature at least twice a day and assess if you are exhibiting symptoms, even mild ones.

resources.string: In particular, fever or at least one of the following: sore throat, cough, cold or blocked nose, breathing difficulty, muscle pain, loss or alteration of sense of smell or taste, diarrhoea.

string.name: suggestions_instruction_isolate_title
string.b: If you display symptoms, isolate yourself from the people you live with.

resources.string: Wear a surgical mask and immediately contact your general practitioner (or primary care paediatrician) and your local health authority\'s healthcare service.

string.name: suggestions_instruction_phone_contact
string.b: If you are having difficulty breathing, contact 112/118.

resources.string: If necessary, you can hide this alert. Unless you have a valid reason, we strongly advise against doing this.
Do you confirm that you are in contact with your general practitioner or local health authority?
Immuni will hide the contact alert. You will still need to follow all the instructions you have received from your general practitioner or local health authority.
Immuni is still working: don\'t uninstall it!
For the time being, you will not receive any new notifications in the event of a risky exposure to a COVID-19-positive user.

string.name: suggestions_positive_covid_negative_message
string.b: Let us know if your local health authority has confirmed that you are COVID-19 negative, to reactivate risky exposure notifications.

resources.string: Do you confirm that you are COVID-19 negative?
Your local health authority needs to have confirmed that you have tested negative for the virus and can leave the house again.

On indication of the ASL, the quarantine period may be reduced to 10 days in the event of a negative antigen or molecular test performed on the tenth day.
Use a well-ventilated private room, if possible with its own bathroom, and minimise the time you spend in other common areas of the house.

string.name: suggestions_instruction_distance
string.b: Keep a distance of at least one metre when around other people.

resources.string: Always carry a mask with you and wear it in indoor places other than your home.
Wear it at home in presence of non-cohabiting people. Also use it outdoors when it is not possible to remain isolated.

Open Immuni once a day to check its status.
Protect yourself and help slow down the epidemic.

Immuni does not collect your name, date of birth, address, telephone number, or email address. Immuni cannot determine your identity or that of the people you come into contact with. Immuni does not collect any geolocation data, including GPS data. The data saved on your smartphone and the connections to the server are encrypted.

During the testing phase, you will only be notified of a high-risk contact with a COVID-19-positive person if this person is assisted by a local health authority in the following regions: Abruzzo, Liguria, Marche, or Puglia.
<red>To protect your health and the health of your loved ones, only disable the service if necessary and reactivate it as soon as you can.</red>
In certain cases, it may make sense to temporarily disable the app, such as while at work if you are a healthcare professional in contact with COVID-19 patients.
If you disable exposure notifications, subsequent contact with other users will not be logged.

resources.string: The app shows you this warning based on the information available (duration of the contact and approximate estimate of the distance), but it cannot know if both parties were wearing masks or had their backs to each other during the contact. Therefore, the risk of infection could be overestimated.

Above the line, describe your queries or issues with the app. If possible, do not delete the text below. It will help the Immuni Support team to better assist you.

string.name: verify_immuni_works_first
string.b: If you see \'Service active\', Immuni is already working properly.

resources.string: If there are any problems, you will see \'Service not active\'. Immuni will provide straightforward instructions to get the app working properly again.

If you\'re exposed to someone who later tests positive for the virus, Immuni will send you a notification to warn you of the risk of infection. When you open the app, you will receive clear and comprehensive guidance on what to do.

For technical reasons, some Android smartphone models may stop Immuni from working if the app remains closed for a few days. When this happens, random codes are still exchanged with other devices, but Immuni is not able to verify if you have been exposed to potentially infectious users and warn you if you are at risk. To prevent this from happening, open the app once a day. Google is working with the manufacturers of these models to solve the problem.
Why location services must be turned on

Immuni uses the exposure notification system developed by Apple, Google and Huawei. Due to an operating system limitation, location services must be turned on to allow background scanning of Bluetooth signals (necessary to exchange random codes and consequently log any contact that occurs).

However, the app does not have access to your location and therefore cannot track your movements. You can easily verify this by checking the list of permissions required by Immuni (available in your phone\'s Settings menu) and noting that authorisation to access your location is not required.
We couldn\'t find any topics that match your search.
How to check that Immuni is working
If you see \'Service active\', Immuni is already working properly. You don\'t need to do anything else: the app will continue working, even when you close it.
If there are any problems, you will see \'Service not active\'. Immuni will provide straightforward instructions to get the app working properly again.

If you come into contact with someone who later tests positive for the virus, Immuni will send you a notification to warn you of the risk of infection. When you open the app, you will receive clear and comprehensive guidance on what to do.
How to report a positive result

If you test positive for the virus, you can report this to Immuni and upload your random codes. By doing so, you allow the app to warn users with whom you have been in contact over the previous days that there is a risk of infection.

The healthcare operator who informs you that your swab has tested positive will assist you by phone. They will ask you for the one-time code displayed on the previous screen, which they will use to give you authorisation to upload your data.

These authorization processes prevent users who have not actually tested positive for the virus from uploading their data and causing false alarms. The one-time code and the data uploaded are not associated with your identity in any way.
If you\'re under 18, please have your parents/legal guardian read this message.
By continuing, I declare that I have read and accepted the {terms of use}
Immuni has detected that you came into close contact with a COVID-19-positive user on %s.
Find out how the app works
Why we ask you to enter your home region and province

The National Health Service uses your home region and province details to help prevent new outbreaks, as well as to estimate how widely the app is being used across the country. Your home province is sent to the Ministry of Health server along with information on whether the app is functioning properly and whether you have been informed of a high-risk contact. Immuni fully protects your privacy in collecting this information.

You can change your home region and province at any time from the app\'s settings menu. We advise you to change them only if you decide to move house. In all other cases, including occasional trips, you do not need to do so.

If you live abroad but intend to travel to Italy, we suggest that you now select the region (and then the province) where you will be staying for the longest during your visit. You can use Immuni even if you are abroad. The app will log your contact with other users as normal. However, you will not be able to upload your random codes if you test positive until you are in Italy.

If you don\'t live in Italy but intend to visit, we suggest that you now select the region (and then the province) where you will be staying for the longest. The same applies if you are already in Italy.
Help us fight the COVID-19 epidemic together. Download Immuni. https://www.immuni.italia.it/

If you are going to Europe you can select the country/s of Interest, if it has/have already joined interoperability, so that Immuni can connect with the other European contact tracing APP\'s and help to contain the spread of Covid-19 in Europe. You can select up to maximum of 3 countries. Your selection will be valid and unchangeable for the next 14 days.
If you are going to another European country
Are you sure you want to proceed?
By confirming you will not be able to remove the chosen countries for the next 14 days
Are you going to one or more of these European countries?
You can select up to a maximum of 3 countries. Your selection will be valid and unchangeable for 14 days
Are you in contact with a healthcare provider?
Follow the procedure to report your being positive
Do you have a CUN code?
You can enter the data directly in the app
This function allows you to report your positivity by directly entering the requested data.
The last eight digits of your Health ID Card
Initial beginning date of the Symptoms
How to report a positive result

If you test positive for the virus, you can report this to Immuni and upload your random codes. By doing so, you allow the app to warn users with whom you have been in contact over the previous days that there is a risk of infection.

The call center operator 800.91.24.91 will assist you by phone. They will ask you for the CUN code, the last 8 digits of the health card, the start date of symptoms and the one-time code displayed on the previous screen, which they will use to give you authorisation to upload your data.

The CUN code is a unique national alphanumeric code (e.g. CUN-AB1234C567) associated with the molecular swab result. It is communicated to citizens via SMS, email or through the electronic health record.

The health card number is a 20-digit code found on the last line on the back of the health card. Remember that it is important to communicate the exact date the symptoms began to initiate accurate contact tracking.
How can I make a report of testing positive
If you test positive for the virus, you can report it independently to Immuni by uploading the CUN code, the last 8 digits of the health card and the beginning date of the symptoms.

By entering this information Immuni will automatically send notifications to other users who have had close contact with you starting two days before the beginning of the symptoms or up to 14 days before the date you took the Swab Test.

The CUN code is a unique national alphanumeric code (e.g. CUN-AB1234C567) associated with the molecular swab result. It is communicated to citizens via SMS, email or through the electronic health record.

The health card number is a 20-digit code found on the last line on the back of the health card. Remember that it is important to communicate the exact date the symptoms began to initiate accurate contact tracking.
- Enter the last 10 characters of the CUN code that was communicated to you\n
- The health card number entered is not formally valid. Make sure you have entered the last 8 digits of your Health Card associated with a positive swab\n
- Enter the date when your symptoms began, if you are symptomatic or check the box if you have no symptoms\n
Do you have a CUN code?
Once you have received the National Unique Code (CUN) you can report your positivity through the toll-free number 800.91.24.91
- The entered CUN is not formally valid. Make sure you have entered the last 10 digits of the CUN you received by SMS or in the report associated with a positive swab\n
Attention. Invalid CUN. Make sure you have entered the last 10 digits of the CUN you received by SMS or in the report associated with a positive swab

It is important to communicate the exact symptom onset date to initiate accurate contact tracking. Select \"no symptoms\" only in case of complete absence of symptoms or the appearance of symptoms after the swab.
What do you want to do today?
The EU Digital Covid Certificate has not yet been recovered
This function allows you to download the COVID-19 green certification (EU Digital Covid Certificate) from the national platform-DGC of the Ministry of Health by entering the required data.
The last eight digits of your Health ID Card
How to acquire the EU Digital Covid Certificate

The \"EU Digital Covid Certificate\", in Italy \"COVID-19 green certification\", is issued by the Ministry of Health in digital format to those who have been vaccinated or have obtained a negative result on the molecular / antigen test or are cured of COVID- 19.

The certificate has a two-dimensional barcode (QR code) that contains the essential information of the holder of the certificate and the health event to which the certificate is associated (vaccination, negative test, COVID-19 cure) and digitally signed to guarantee authenticity.

If you have received the code to recover the certification via email or SMS, you can use this App by entering one of the unique codes CUN, NRFE, NUCG, CUEV (received respectively during the execution of the molecular swab or the execution of the antigenic swab or the preparation of the healing certificate ), or the AUTHCODE authorization code received via e-mail or SMS together with the last 8 digits of the identification number and the expiry date of the Health Card.
All these codes are uniquely associated with the COVID-19 green certificate relating to the health event that generated it.
For more information visit the website www.dgc.gov.it
EU Digital Covid Certificate successfully recovered
- Enter the last 10 characters of the CUN code that was communicated to you\n
- Enter the last 17 characters of the NRFE code that was communicated to you\n
- Enter the last 10 characters of the NUCG code that was communicated to you\n
- Enter the last 10 characters of the CUEV code that was communicated to you\n
- Enter the last 12 characters of the AUTHCODE that was communicated to you\n
- The entered CUN is not formally valid. Make sure you have entered the last 10 digits of the CUN you received by SMS or in the report associated with a positive swab\n
- The entered NRFE code is not formally valid. Make sure you have entered the last 17 digits of the NRFE code you received\n
- The entered NUCG code is not formally valid. Make sure you have entered the last 10 digits of the NUCG code you received\n
- The entered CUEV code is not formally valid. Make sure you have entered the last 10 digits of the CUEV code you received\n
- The AUTHCODE entered is not formally valid. Make sure you have entered the last 12 digits of the AUTHCODE you received\n
- Enter the expiration date of the health card\n
Are you sure you want to delete your EU Digital Covid Certificate?
EU Digital Covid Certificate recovery in progress..

This certificate is not a travel document. The scientific evidence on COVID-19 vaccination, testing and recovery continues to evolve, including in consideration of the new variants of the virus. Before traveling, please check the public health measures applied in the place of destination and the related restrictions also by consulting the website:
E\' necessario attivare i permessi di scrittura per poter scaricare l\'EU Digital Covid Certificate.
Disease or agent the citizen has recovered from
Malattia o agente bersaglio da cui la persona è guarita
Soggetto che ha rilasciato la certificazione
Soggetto che ha rilasciato la certificazione
Vaccine marketing authorisation holder or manufacturer
Produttore o titolare dell\'AIC del vaccino

Numero della dose effettuata/numero totale dosi previste
Stato in cui è stata eseguita la vaccinazione
Date of first positive NAAT test result (yyyy-mm-dd)
Data del primo test molecolare positivo
Nome del test antigienico e nome del produttore
Date and time of the test sample collection
Data e ora del prelievo del campione
Centro o struttura in cui è stato eseguito il test
Stato in cui è stato eseguito il test
Stato in cui è stato eseguito primo test molecolare positivo
Validity of the EU Digital Covid Certificate
Certification valid for 365 days (12 months) from the date of the last administration
Certification valid for 48 hours from the time of collection
Certification valid for 72 hours from the time of collection
No EU Digital Covid Certificate found. Check that the data entered is correct
China Sinopharm International Corp. - Beijing location
Sinopharm Weiqida Europe Pharmaceutical s.r.o. - Prague location
Sinopharm Zhijun (Shenzhen) Pharmaceutical Co. Ltd. - Shenzhen location
Covaxin (also known as BBV152 A, B, C)

The green COVID–19 certification is shown on the smartphone screen so that it can be viewed and shown on request, in case of verification, even in offline mode. The \"Delete\" button allows you to delete your certificate from your smartphone independently at any time.
Certification valid in the European Union until the end of validity date and valid only in Italy up to 6 months from the start of validity date
We have changed the order of your Certificates

If you are reading this message it means that you have more than one COVID-19 Green Certificate installed on your device: they are now displayed in chronological order starting with the most recent. Remember that you can delete them or move from one to the other by swiping sideways with your finger
Fiscal code of the certifying physician
Data di inizio validità della certificazione
Person exempt from SARS-CoV-2 / COVID-19 vaccination
Data di fine validità della certificazione

This certification is valid only in Italy and can be used to replace the COVID-19 green certification for carrying out activities and the use of services in accordance with the current national legislation
Digital certification of COVID-19 vaccination exemption
Soggetto che ha rilasciato la certificazione digitale di esenzione
Certification valid for 180 days (6 months) from the date of the last administration, subject to regulatory changes
